text: hi <@U027JEHGZRA> quick question: when I'm trying to add polish translation (plus sign icon) for Cluster (c files), I'm getting 'access denied'. Do you have sufficient permissions to create pl.po file here <https://translate.rx.studio/new-lang/the-r-project-recommended-packages/cluster-c-files/> ? If so, then please create it and grant me permissions to edit it. thanks!

attachments.text: This site runs Weblate for localizing various software projects.
attachments.title: Sign in

elements.text: hi
quick question: when I'm trying to add polish translation (plus sign icon) for Cluster (c files), I'm getting 'access denied'. Do you have sufficient permissions to create pl.po file here
? If so, then please create it and grant me permissions to edit it. thanks!

text: that's a great question <@U03GLCB9WAJ>, but unfortunately, I'm not aware. it was a good opportunity to meet with other translators at the R Dev Day in person, but I agree that something similar even virtually would make a lot of sense. I'd suggest checking with other folks translating the same language here on slack and schedule something? maybe others will also follow :blush:

elements.text: that's a great question

, but unfortunately, I'm not aware. it was a good opportunity to meet with other translators at the R Dev Day in person, but I agree that something similar even virtually would make a lot of sense. I'd suggest checking with other folks translating the same language here on slack and schedule something? maybe others will also follow

text: sure thing, <https://translate.rx.studio/projects/the-r-project-recommended-packages/cluster-c-files/pl/> was just created -- please let me know if you run into any other permission issues .. it seems that we have set up access rights differently in the recommended packages than in R core

attachments.fallback: Weblate: The R Project recommended packages/cluster (C files) — Polish
attachments.text: The R Project recommended packages is being translated into 13 languages using Weblate. Join the translation or start translating your own project.
